alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Nemaha (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 29 at 6:29AM CDT until June 29 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN JOHNSON...SOUTHERN NEMAHA...RICHARDSON AND NORTHEASTERN PAWNEE COUNTIES... At 629 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles northwest of Stella, or 6 miles south of Auburn, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Falls City, Auburn, Pawnee City, Humboldt, Table Rock, Verdon, Stella, Shubert, Nemaha, Dawson, Brownville, Salem, Elk Creek, Steinauer, Barada, Brownville State Recreation Area, Indian Cave State Park, The Highway 62 and 105 Junction, Howe and Kirkmans Cove Recreation Area. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
